query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: B4P innovation cluster Charter
result.description: This deliverable synthetises the outputs of task T1.2 and will include a description of the Charter, introducing to the value proposition of the B4P ICs network and commitments from the B4P ICs.

project.title: New European Bauhaus Unlocked through Built4People-endorsed Local Actions

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Strengthening European coordination and exchange for innovation uptake towards sustainability, quality, circularity and social inclusion in the built environment as a contribution to the new European Bauhaus (Built4People)

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

programme.title: Climate, Energy and Mobility

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Buildings and Industrial Facilities in Energy Transition

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Review of most promising co-financing models to foster open innovation
result.description: This report synthesises the findings of T4.1 and will identify the most promising public and private co-financing models that are best suited to each TRL.

result.title: Integration of monitoring information into green resilience management
result.description: Scientific technical report on the developed decision-support method to optimize the design of structural monitoring systems for critical elements (i.e., bridges) of the transportation network. It is the main output of Task 2.4. In case the report presents a successful way to solve Task 2.4, it can be seen as success.

project.title: Sustainability And Resilience for Infrastructure and Logistics networks

result.title: Strategies for improving resilience through participatory stakeholder practices – Delphi survey results
result.description: Report on the results from the Delphi survey. It is the main output of Task 1.3. The surveys of this task, filled by stakeholders, should collect information on the detection, consequences and uncertainties of disruptive events as well as mitigation measures to tackle those disruptions. Additionally, future expected disruptions, i.e., stakeholder outlooks, are collected. The report can be seen as success if the partners get a comprehensive picture on the survey output.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
